meanings.def: an arrangement that somebody has with a bank, etc. to keep money there, take some out, etc.
examples: I don't have a bank account.
I paid the money into my savings account.
a joint account (= one in the name of more than one person)
With internet banking you can manage your account online.
account with somebody/something Do you have an account with us?
account at something He opened an account at a bank in Germany.
Interest will be paid monthly into the account holder's current account.
What's your account number please?
She deposited the check in her account.
I have a savings account with a building society.
I paid the cheque into my current account.
Your account is overdrawn.
They have a numbered account in Switzerland.
The money will be credited to your account tomorrow.
She opened a savings account at the bank.
She had taken all her money out of her account.
My husband and I have separate accounts.
I'd like to open an account, please.
I have an account with another bank.
Go and see the manager of the bank where your account is held.

meanings.def: an arrangement that somebody has with a company that allows them to use the internet, send and receive messages by email, social media, etc.
examples: an email/a Twitter account
Millions of accounts have been hacked.

meanings.def: a written or spoken description of something that has happened
examples: an eyewitness account (= a description given by somebody who saw what happened)
a first-hand/personal/first-person account
account of something Can you give us an account of what happened?
The diaries contained a detailed account of the writer's experiences in China.
Are these newspaper reports true?
It was many years before the full story was made public.
the front-page story
She gave the police a full account of the incident.
She gave us her version of what had happened that day.
Dr Richards describes this very well in his account of the events.
He gave us a blow-by-blow account of the incident.
She received a glowing account of her son's progress.
the newspaper account of the trial
She gave the police a full account of the incident.

meanings.def: an explanation or a description of an idea, a theory or a process
examples: the Biblical account of the creation of the world

meanings.def: a written record of money that is owed to a business and of money that has been paid by it
examples: to do the accounts
to keep the accounts up to date
the accounts department
She works in Accounts (= the accounts department).
Try to keep accurate accounts.
The accounts are all in order.
Your accounts will need to be submitted to the tax office.

meanings.def: an arrangement with a shop or business to pay bills for goods or services at a later time, for example in regular amounts every month
examples: Put it on my account please.
We have accounts with most of our suppliers.
Log in to your account to see how much you have spent.
the gas bill
Put it on my account please.
The builders sent an invoice for £250.
Can I have the check, please?
Charge this to my account, please.
an account with a large store

meanings.def: a bill for goods or services provided over a period
examples: Departing guests should settle their accounts at the office.
It is best to settle the account each month.

meanings.def: a regular customer
examples: The agency has lost several of its most important accounts.

meanings.def: a description of an event that gives you all the details in the order in which they happen
examples: He insisted on giving us a blow-by-blow account of what had happened.

meanings.def: according to what other people say
examples: I've never been there, but it's a lovely place, by all accounts.

meanings.def: according to what you say yourself
examples: By his own account he had an unhappy childhood.

meanings.def: to make somebody explain a mistake, etc. because they are responsible for it
to do something or perform well, especially in a contest
examples: The team gave a good account of themselves in the match.

meanings.def: not important
examples: Emotional matters were of no account to them during the war.

meanings.def: if you buy something or pay on account, you pay nothing or only a small amount immediately and the rest later
examples: Call a cab on account.
Ring for a cab on account.
She bought the furniture she wanted on account.

meanings.def: because of what you think somebody wants
examples: Please don't change your plans on my account.

meanings.def: because of somebody/something
examples: She retired early on account of ill health.
The marsh is an area of great scientific interest on account of its wild flowers.
The number of people with diabetes is growing, partly because of an increase in levels of obesity.
The number of overweight children has increased dramatically in recent years, largely as a result of changes in diet and lifestyle.
The increase in childhood obesity is largely due to/the result of changes in lifestyle and diet over the last twenty years.
Many obese children are bullied at school on account of their weight.
Part of the problem with treating childhood obesity stems from the fact that parents do not always recognize that their children are obese.
Childhood obesity may be caused by genetic factors, as well as environmental ones.

meanings.def: not for any reason
examples: On no account should the house be left unlocked.

meanings.def: for yourself
examples: In 2012 Smith set up in business on his own account.

meanings.def: because you want to and you have decided, not somebody else
examples: No one sent me. I am here on my own account.

meanings.def: because of the particular thing that has been mentioned
examples: Weather conditions were poor, but he did not delay his departure on that account.

meanings.def: to use something in a good or helpful way
examples: He turned his artistic talents to good account by becoming a sculptor.

meanings.def: to hurt or punish somebody who has harmed or cheated you in the past
examples: ‘Who would do such a thing?’ ‘Maybe someone with an old score to settle.’
An embittered Charlotte is determined to settle accounts with Elizabeth.

meanings.def: to consider particular facts, circumstances, etc. when making a decision about something
examples: The company takes account of environmental issues wherever possible.
Coursework is taken into account as well as exam results.

meanings.def: to have the opinion that somebody/something is a particular thing
examples: be accounted + adj. In English law a person is accounted innocent until they are proved guilty.
be accounted + noun The event was accounted a success.

meanings.def: used to say how difficult it is to understand why somebody likes somebody/something that you do not like at all
examples: She thinks he's wonderful—oh well, there's no accounting for taste.

idioms.def: used to say how difficult it is to understand why somebody likes somebody/something that you do not like at all
examples: She thinks he's wonderful—oh well, there's no accounting for taste.
